title: 112_hr6659
content: The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" is cited as the short title. It extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specific cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Economic development extension bonds issued within a specified period are treated as qualified bonds with increased incentives and interest inclusion in gross income. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specific cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Specified bonds are defined as obligations where interest would be excludable from gross income under section 103, with certain conditions and rules applying. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Qualified purposes include qualified economic development purposes defined in section 1400U-2(c) for specified cities treated as recovery zones. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities with high unemployment rates and population loss between 2000 and 2010. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities that have lost at least 20 percent of their population between 2000 and 2010. The maximum aggregate face amount of bonds designated for any city is limited based on its population proportion to the total population of all specified cities. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for specified cities based on their population proportion to the total population of all specified cities. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for part III of subchapter Y of chapter 1 of the Code. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
